bomberman.core.ui.UIScreen

Packages that use UIScreen

Uses of UIScreen in bomberman.core
 

Fields in bomberman.core declared as UIScreen
private  UIScreen BomberMan.delegate
          The screen that is currently active and should receive input focus
private  UIScreen BomberMan.gameScreen
          The resources associated with the game screen that players see when a new round is started.
private  UIScreen BomberMan.loadScreen
          The resources associated with the load screen that players see while resources are loading
private  UIScreen BomberMan.loseScreen
          The resources associated with the game screen that players see when a round has ended.
private  UIScreen BomberMan.pauseScreen
          The resources associated with the game screen that players see when the game is paused.
private  UIScreen BomberMan.startScreen
          The resources associated with the game screen that players see when the game starts.
private  UIScreen BomberMan.winScreen
          The resources associated with the game screen that shows up when player wins
 

Uses of UIScreen in bomberman.core.ui
 

Classes in bomberman.core.ui that implement UIScreen
 class GameScreen
          The Class UIGameScreen is responsible of instantiating the graphic and logic game classes.
 class LoadScreen
          The LoadScreen class is responsible of loading all screen's resources, while providing an interface.
 class LoseScreen
          The LoseScreen class responsible of displaying the "Game Over" message.
 class PauseScreen
          The PauseScreen class takes control when the game is paused.
 class StartScreen
          The StartScreen class provides a main UI screen, it's displayed when the program starts.
 class WinScreen
          The WinScreen class responsible of displaying the victory message.
 

Fields in bomberman.core.ui declared as UIScreen
private  UIScreen[] LoadScreen.screens
          The screens to load
 

Constructors in bomberman.core.ui with parameters of type UIScreen
LoadScreen(BomberMan bomberman, UIScreen... screens)
          The LoadScreen class is responsible of loading all screen's resources, while providing an interface.
